title: TIP: "Connection Security" in "Server Settings" set to STARTTLS helps with slow email downloading problem
content:
Like some other users, my TB (v134.0.1) was still slow to find and download my emails. Even though TB was lightning fast for years before this slowness epidemic started, I decided to fiddle with settings. I tried various things that seemed logical, but had no success until I changed the "Connection Security" in "Server Settings" for all my accounts from SSL/TLS to STARTTLS. My guess is that the TB devs have changed the way it communicates with mail servers about security and some can't deal with it quickly enough!

Your mileage will likely vary, so make a note of your settings before changing anything and only ever change one type of setting at a time in only one account before doing a test. I hope this helps at least some users and reduces their frustration.
creator: Jay.Dear

title: Topic: Unable to send emails: Message says (Add Security Exception)

I have no idea what all this means. It's only just started happening since I did a Thunderbird upgrade. I hope you are able to help me please? My apologies but I'm unable to attach screenshot pictures. Thank you for your time. Kind Regards Jen

title: Problems with "Get Messages"
content:
Win 7 Thunderbird (newest version for Win 7, I believe)

Around the end of last year (2024), when I click"Get Messages" to retrieve emails I haven't downloaded yet, a window opens that looks exactly like the Yahoo log in account. As default, my email address is displayed, and I click "Next". Then the yahoo "Enter password" window opens. I am supposed to enter my password to proceed "Next". Here is where I stopped proceeding. I looked at the URL address and it says: https://tsdtocl.com/. It looked suspicious so I didn't go any further.

FYI, I have 2 email accounts. The second email account proceeds normally, retrieving emails I have not downloaded yet, automatically.

Furthermore, I installed Win 10 into a new partition and installed Thunderbird. I tried setting my email account, entered the necessary information, and after clicking "Continue", the same thing happens. A new window looking like "Yahoo log in Account" appears.

Am I doing something wrong here? Or am I safe to proceed with entering my password?

title: Incoming messages lost after removing .msf files
content:
I deleted all of the .msf files from my profile using a tool called "thunderfix." To the best of my knowledge, all that it does is remove the msf files from the profile folder. It's always worked well and cleaned up a slow opening inbox for many years.

However, after running thunderfix yesterday and restarting Thunderbird (Win 11, version 128.6.0esr (64-bit)), I could hear the incoming message chime, but the messages never appeared.

The screen was blank on first open, with no messages appearing, existing or new incoming ones, but the existing ones appeared after I moved to another folder and returned to the inbox. The new messages never appeared. I know they were sent and received as I keep a backup of all of my incoming emails on a separate gmail account.

Once the inbox came back with the existing messages, new incoming messages appeared as they usually do.

Does anyone know what might have happened and if the 10-15 missing messages in Thunderbird can be recovered without resorting to the the gmail backup?

Where did they go after I heard the incoming chime?

Also, is Thunderfix no longer a reliable tool?
